title: San Antonio Rampage lose eighth straight match, falling to San Jose Barracuda
title_page: San Antonio Rampage lose eighth straight match, falling to San Jose Barracuda
maintext:
The San Antonio Rampage suffered their eighth consecutive loss, falling 2-1 to the San Jose Barracuda on Friday at the AT&T Center.
The Rampage are 1-8-0-0 on the year, ranking last in the AHL standings with two points. San Antonio also ranks tied for last in the AHL averaging two goals per game.
San Jose scored first when Francis Perron tallied at 5:50 of the second period, assisted by Kyle Wood and Jeremy Roy. San Antonio drew even when Adam Musil scored at 5:28 of the third period, assisted by Klim Kostin and Nolan Stevens. The Barracuda scored the game winning goal at 7:14 of the final period, when Matt Fonteyne scored on assists from Lukas Radil and Wood.
Ville Husso stopped 19 of 21 shots for San Antonio, while San Joseâ€™s Josef Korenar made 27 saves against 28 shots.
The Rampage host the Chicago Wolves at 3 p.m. Sunday.
